page.title: 13LESNES WOODS
page.content: Lesnes Woods used to be used for a timber ground where they cut the trees down then let them grow again. Lesnes is used as a leisure place now where people go to take their dogs for a walk or they go for a jog. In the winter it is a good place for sledging down the big slopes. Lesnes is a big woods and it has lots of hills and slopes. On a clear day you can see right across to Thamesmead and a little further. Attatched to Lesnes Woods is Lesnes Abbey now in ruins. In the wood itself there are a lot of wild flowers like bluebells, daffodils and anemones. There are wild animals too and one of the most common is the grey squirrel. It can be a nuisance to trees by pulling the bark off. I go there quite a lot to take the dog for a walk . It is my favourite wood. Jennifer Webb.
